title: Production publish readiness for CryptoLaunch Sentinel (frontend)

requirements.summary: Switch Discover feed from mock-generated projects to backend-fetched projects and show a clear message when live data is unavailable.
acceptanceCriteria: Discover page no longer relies on frontend/src/features/discover/providers/providers.ts mock generator for its primary data path.
Frontend requests new-project discovery data via the backend actor (React Query or existing actor hooks) instead of returning hardcoded demo projects.
If real provider integration is not configured/available, the UI shows a clear non-technical message that live data is unavailable and does not silently substitute mock projects.

file_operations.description: Remove/disable the mock project generator as the primary data path and refactor this module to fetch discovery projects via the backend actor (e.g., using existing actor hooks/React Query) and map backend Project data into ProjectSummary. Use the core-infrastructure backend connection setup (actor) for published builds. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update polling/refresh logic to use the backend-mediated projects fetch (not the mock generator). Ensure loading/error/refresh states propagate cleanly for the Discover feed.

Update the error/empty states to show an English, non-technical message when live project data is unavailable (and avoid substituting demo/mock projects). Ensure manual refresh continues to work with the backend fetch.

requirements.summary: Make Settings > Data Providers show real runtime readiness fetched from the backend with clear user-facing states.
acceptanceCriteria: Provider status values shown in the UI are fetched from the backend at runtime (not hardcoded constants).
The panel clearly differentiates: active (working), needs configuration (missing keys), and unavailable/error states.
User-facing text is in English and does not mention internal implementation details (e.g., no references to file names or mock generators).

file_operations.description: Add React Query hooks for fetching available provider IDs and their runtime status via the backend actor, returning UI-friendly readiness states (active / needs configuration / unavailable-or-error). Use the core-infrastructure actor access pattern already in place. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace the hardcoded PROVIDERS list with runtime-fetched providers and statuses from the backend via React Query hooks. Render clear English labels for: Active, Needs configuration, and Unavailable/Error, without referencing internal implementation details.

requirements.summary: Ensure user profile UI contains no email fields or email-related messaging.
acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo UserProfile no longer includes an email field, and related save/get logic is updated accordingly.
Any frontend profile setup/edit UI does not request, display, or store an email value.
No user-facing UI suggests email verification, email login, or email notifications.

file_operations.description: Audit and ensure the profile setup form only collects name and optional bio (no email field, no email-related copy). Keep payload aligned with the backend UserProfile type.
Audit and ensure the profile edit section only displays/edits name and bio (no email field, no email-related copy or settings).

requirements.summary: Finalize publish-facing document title and meta description for CryptoLaunch Sentinel.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html has an app-appropriate title and meta description for “CryptoLaunch Sentinel”.
No user-facing placeholder/template text remains in the main page metadata.

file_operations.description: Set/confirm the document <title> and meta description are publish-appropriate for “CryptoLaunch Sentinel” and remove any remaining template/placeholder wording.
